Mark Zuckerberg donated more than $400 million in at least 47 states for local elections in 2020. Even though the DNC believes that this was the most secure election in the history of all elections, Wisconsin voters didn‚Äôt like that sort of outside influence and have approved a ban on private money support in elections.

In other
title: No more "Zuckerbucks!" Swing state voters rebel, approve ban on private money for elections

description:
A couple of weeks ago we reported that a public library was waiving late fees in exchange for cat pics. Today we have a similar story for you. Except instead of trading in cat pics, you trade in prison time.

A mom in Texas had a warrant issued for her arrest over a library book. And I wish I was joking.

I also know what you are thinking. And I agree. This could have made a great Seinfeld episode.

‚Äî (@)
title: Texas Mom discovers there is a warrant out for her arrest... over an overdue library book

We all know that there is no such thing as equality in the progressive pursuit of equity. But that won‚Äôt stop leftists from using that word to trick people into implementing their deranged agenda, which is exactly what New York officials are doing.

New Yorkers will vote on a state ballot measure in Nov. dubbed the ‚ÄúEqual Rights Amendment.‚Äù But rather than implement equality, critics believe this will actually strip parents of their inherent right to raise their kids.
title: New York progressives propose amendment to essentially replace parents, but some NYers are fighting back

title: Karine Jean-Pierre's brain short circuits when reporter asks: So what about when Joe Biden calls things a "bloodbath?"

description:
In the 90's-00's, when celebrities would flex by showing how expensive their "cribs" were and rappers would pop Crys in their mansions with all their fresh Bentleys, the flex was that they owned it. Of course, we know now in most cases they rented and/or were in massive debt. The Roots have a great video about it for "What They Do." But they at least pretended. That's not the case with everyone's new favorite viral video this week, where this dame brags about $3000 worth of monthly car payments.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm financially illiterate‚Äù influencers will never not be funny to me. pic.twitter.com/bmmS0LlT1w
‚Äî Louder with Crowder Dot Com (@LWCnewswire)
title: Watch: Woman goes viral for odd flex of how expensive her car payments are, then throws her husband under the Tahoe
